variants.Description in input context: c.1234G>A (p.G412D) is associated with autosomal recessive Parkinson's disease.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transiently transfected with wild-type or mutant PINK1 plasmids.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.G412D variant exhibited reduced ubiquitination activity of parkin compared to wild-type PINK1.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Ubiquitination activity â‰¥ 80% of wild-type levels.
